alert.note: Alert for Northern Franklin; Northern Oxford; Southern Franklin; Southern Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 22 at 9:29PM EST until February 23 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...LOW PRESSURE TO BRING SNOW AND MIXED PRECIPITATION TO THE REGION TONIGHT AND THURSDAY... .Low pressure will move across southern New England late tonight and Thursday. Snow is expected to overspread the area from west to east tonight and may be heavy at times overnight into early Thursday morning. Sleet may mix in late tonight and Thursday morning, mainly across southern New Hampshire. Another period of snow or mixed precipitation may occur Thursday night into early Friday with more minor accumulations possible. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations between 7 and 10 inches for a storm total of 7 to 10 inches. * WHERE...Portions of western Maine. Portions of northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...A snowstorm will bring plowable snow to the region with a period of moderate travel impacts expected. Periods of moderate snow and low visibility will be the biggest hazards. The potential exists for snowbands that will bring periods of locally heavy snowfall, which will lead to rapid snow accumulations and extremely dangerous travel conditions. Periods of moderate and heavy snow will combine with low visibility to create dangerous driving conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
